intro: Gasteranthus anomalus, commonly known as the "flowering gourd," is a unique plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that are often brightly colored. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that resemble gourds, which are edible when ripe. Its botanical features include hairy stems and alternate leaves with a rough texture. Gasteranthus anomalus is typically found in humid, shaded environments at moderate altitudes.
